comments.body:
Would it be worth replacing these strings with enums so that we can have `[]framework.ClusterEvent` instead? Check with a performance benchmark.

Then we would need to have a `ToString` method for the enum type so that we can still use them in event labels.

It's a good point.

As these strings are pre-existing, let me add a TODO here, and refactor in a follow-up if needed.

Do we actually need this registry at all? we can construct the event on the fly: instead of passing in `AssignedPodAdd` and then look up the `framework.ClusterEvent`, just pass the cluster event directly (i.e., `{Resource: framework.Pod, ActionType: framework.Add}`), for example here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/e1c1fd9edf9bd4d9d0e749b16fb33a54399a1ef8/pkg/scheduler/internal/queue/scheduling_queue.go#L485

And add a ToString on the ClusterEvent type itself for logging and whatnot.

are any of those constants used in more than one place?

SGTM.

In this case, we have to change the signature of `SchedulingQueue#MoveAllToActiveOrBackoffQueue(event string)`, which would generate a number of changes. To offload the review work in this PR, mind refactoring it in a follow-up?
doing it in a follow up PR sounds good.
mind tracking the followups somewhere? perhaps a checklist in a comment in the original issue?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +77,81 @@// making clusterEventReg a []framework.ClusterEvent.
var clusterEventReg = map[string]framework.ClusterEvent{
	AssignedPodAdd:              {Resource: framework.Pod, ActionType: framework.Add},
	AssignedPodUpdate:           {Resource: framework.Pod, ActionType: framework.Update},
	AssignedPodDelete:           {Resource: framework.Pod, ActionType: framework.Delete},
